description:
The Hameln II was an Imperial destroyer which was part of Destroyer Squadron 237, and was ambushed by Alliance ships while on patrol in the Iserlohn Corridor in 791 UC. Despite being heavily damaged, the Hameln II managed to escape from the area under the leadership of Reinhard von Musel and underwent repairs at Iserlohn Fortress.
The piper insignia and the name Hameln II are references to the German name for Hamelin, a city in central Germany famous for the Pied Piper legend.
Gineipedia
name: Hameln II
